entry.title: Time-Dilation Attacks on Offchain Protocols
entry.summary: Antoine Riard shared information about Time-Dilation Attacks on Offchain Protocols. In response to this, Dave asked about the advantage of these attacks over the eclipse attacker not relaying honest user's commitment or penalty transactions to miners. It is unclear from the given context what exactly Time-Dilation Attacks are and how they work. The email includes a non-text attachment, which is a signature.asc file with a size of 833 bytes.
